snippet: The Obama administration said it would expedite visas for those Haitians who have already been approved to join family members in the United States.
abstract: Obama administration says that beginning in 2015 it will reduce lengthy delays facing thousands of Haitians who have already been approved to join family members in United States and become legal permanent residents; more than 100,000 have been approved for residency visas, known as green cards, but annual caps have forced waits of up to a dozen years for some.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said it would expedite visas for those Haitians who have already been approved to join family members in the United States.

headline.main: Obama Administration to Expedite Family Reunification for Some Haitians
headline.print_headline: Obama Administration to Expedite Family Reunification for Some Haitians
